post_text:
The smoke from surrounding wildfires has caused our air quality to dip into the "Very Unhealthy" category. We will still have school, but recesses and PE will all be indoors. Regular recesses will be in classrooms. Lunch recess will be in the gym. I have spoken with Mr. Hatrock, and he will have PE in the gym so our students will still be getting some activity.

At this time, it looks like we will be doing this through at least Wednesday. Obviously, we will continue to monitor the situation and adjust as necessary.

I know this is not the best way to start the school year, but keeping students safe doesn't come with a schedule. Thank you for your flexibility and positive attitude. This too shall pass.
Thank you and have a great day!!!

Moving Day Update

We’ve had several people ask if their children are helping move as well. As much as we appreciate your help, it is probably best if younger students (K-3) are not helping move things. So we are asking, if at all possible, that you make other arrangements for them during this time as we will not be able to provide supervision for them. We want them to be safe and also, there is only so much room on the sidewalks where heavy items are being transported. Older students (4-8) may help if they would like and have your permission.

Thanks again everybody…it’s getting pretty exciting around here!!!

STEM Charter Academy goes K-12

In answer to your repeated requests and overwhelming support of this school, we have been working for months with the State Department of Education and the Idaho Public Charter Commission on expanding STEM Charter to high school. We were approved this morning by the Idaho Public Charter Commission to move forward.

We will begin with 9th grade next year and add a grade level each year through 12th grade. We will hold a meeting in late January or early February to provide specific details of our high school program. This is a very exciting day for the students of North Idaho!!!! Again, thank you for your support and your wonderful children!

Scott and Colleen Thomson
